greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Start of the first occurrence of exactly n consecutive squares with digit sum also a square.
example: a(7) = 81 as the sums of the digits of the 7 consecutive squares 81, 100, 121, 144, 169, 196, 225 are squares, but the digit sums of 64 and 256 are not.
mathematica: l[n_] := Module[{k}, For[k=0, IntegerQ[Sqrt[Plus@@IntegerDigits[(n+k)^2]]], k++, Null]; k]; Clear[a]; For[n=0, True, n+=ln+1, If[a[ln=l[n]]==-1, Null, Null, a[ln]=n; Print["a(", ln, ")=", n^2]]]
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Mar 09 2002
